unnormalised: CBSE class 10th results are expected to be out soon, maybe by next week, as per sources. Students and parents are already feeling the pressure, especially with cut-offs being so high these days. Remember last year? Some schools saw 98% as the minimum for science stream.
normalised: C-B-S-E class tenth results are expected to be out soon, maybe by next week, as per sources. Students and parents are already feeling the pressure, especially with cut-offs being so high these days. Remember last year? Some schools saw ninety eight percent as the minimum for science stream.

unnormalised: The rumour mill is churning with potential dates. Some say 20/05/2024, while others are betting on 27/05/2024. But don't stress too much about the exact date! Keep checking the official CBSE website – cbse.nic.in – for the confirmed announcement. All the best, bachchon!
normalised: The rumour mill is churning with potential dates. Some say twentieth May two thousand and twenty four, while others are betting on twenty seventh May two thousand and twenty four. But don't stress too much about the exact date! Keep checking the official C-B-S-E website – c-b-s-e dot n-i-c dot in – for the confirmed announcement. All the best, bachchon!

unnormalised: This year, reportedly over 21 lakh students appeared for the class 10th exams across India & abroad. Girls usually outperform boys, let's see if that trend continues. Passing marks are still 33% overall, but remember, individual subject scores matter too.
normalised: This year, reportedly over twenty one lakh students appeared for the class tenth exams across India and abroad. Girls usually outperform boys, let's see if that trend continues. Passing marks are still thirty three percent overall, but remember, individual subject scores matter too.

unnormalised: Once the results are declared, you can access your marksheet using your roll number & school code. Keep those details handy! Don't believe everything you read on WhatsApp forwards - official information is the key. Good luck to all the students who gave the exams! Hope you all score well.
normalised: Once the results are declared, you can access your marksheet using your roll number and school code. Keep those details handy! Don't believe everything you read on WhatsApp forwards - official information is the key. Good luck to all the students who gave the exams! Hope you all score well.
